message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper is about knowledge aware conversation generation, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on using knowledge graphs and unstructured texts for conversation generation, which is a common topic in the subfield of NLP known as computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper uses machine learning techniques such as multi-hop graph reasoning and machine reading comprehension, which are common in the subfields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques for selecting relevant knowledge from the augmented graph. Finally, the paper discusses the benefits of using explainable reasoning, which is a topic of interest in the subfield of social and information networks (cs.SI).
